messages.message:
*Derived Fields Feedback*
Hey team, been playing around with the Derived Fields flag - overall wow, this is going to be such a good addition :raised_hands: Couple of pieces of feedback, mainly around the UX:
1. Hitting `'Enter'` while in the prompt box gives you a new line. This is inconsistent with other fields where it runs the prompt
2. We need a better way to nudge users on how to use this field. Maybe just auto-filling the box with a greyed out suggestion that disappears when you type?
3. Instead of field suggestions popping up automatically, I think it should require the '@' symbol. Makes it cleaner when typing. I also think field names should be more differentiated from normal text (its only bold atm)
4. How does this work? Are we creating code in the background or are the fields and task being sent to an LLM?
    a. If the user can't quite get what they want in terms of behaviour, they could tweak code. If its the latter option, I think they'd have to fall back to a custom function field and start coding from scratch
5. Can we use this flow for prompt-based validations? Generally I avoid using these as they are slow, confusing and often produce errors. Using derived fields was a much better experience overall :blush:

> 4. How does this work? Are we creating code in the background or are the fields and task being sent to an LLM?
we are not creating code in the background

we are sending the field values and the derived field prompt to the LLM, which is similar to what we do for cleaning prompts

correct, the fallback is to create a custom function field

> 5. Can we use this flow for prompt-based validations?
that’s a good idea! we haven’t tested this use case much, so please try it out and give us feedback!

> 1. Hitting `'Enter'` while in the prompt box gives you a new line. This is inconsistent with other fields where it runs the prompt
good point! created a ticket ^

> 2. We need a better way to nudge users on how to use this field. Maybe just auto-filling the box with a greyed out suggestion that disappears when you type?
i agree that most users won’t know how to use this :disappointed: but it’s also difficult to show a helpful and relevant suggestion for every use case

would a suggestion like appending the second field to the first field be helpful? ex: for the Bank Statement pre-built class, “append *Account Holder Name* to *Bank Name*”

> 3. Instead of field suggestions popping up automatically, I think it should require the ‘@’ symbol. Makes it cleaner when typing. I also think field names should be more differentiated from normal text (its only bold atm)
yeah this was to be consistent with prompt-based validations

if we want to make this change, we’ll need to change both derived fields and prompt-based validations

I like your suggestion for 2. Agree that its hard, but I think just understanding the format of the prompt is the main thing (like can the fields come at the beginning, end, or middle of prompt etc. Can I use multiple...)
Imo both should be changed to use '@'
cc @melissa.amos in case you have any suggestions for 2

btw thank you for all of this feedback! :heart: we’re glad to hear that the feature is helpful! :blob_excited:

cc @danny.lan

I think #2 probably needs some design input. I agree that some placeholder text would be useful, but I'd ideally like to think options through with a designer.

I wonder if we can also address the issue that the prompt field is immediately in an error state.
